Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: revisore per le riviste Journal of Semantics, Natural Language Semantics, Semantics & Pragmatics, Linguistic Inquiry, Linguistics & Philosophy, Cognition
membro del comitato editoriale della rivista Semantics & Pragmatics

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Invited talk “Neg-raising inferences: presuppositions or scalar implicatures?” per il Presuppositions in Context, workshop al Lichtenberg-Kolleg, Göttingen.
“A scalar implicature-based approach to Neg-raising inferences”, Department of Linguistics presso la New York University, New York, USA
Invited talk “Comparing the processing of presuppositions and that of scalar implicatures”, Linguistic Forum presso la Cambridge University, Regno Unito
Invited talk “Presupposition in quantificational sentences: children’s and adults’ data” Linguistic colloquium series, Utrecht University, Utrecht

Zehr, Jeremy, Bill, Cory, Tieu, Lyn, Romoli, Jacopo, and Schwarz, Florian, Experimental evidence for existential presupposition projection from ‘none’ talk presentation at Amsterdam Colloquium 2015, Amsterdam

Zehr, Jeremy, Bill, Cory, Tieu, Lyn, Romoli, Jacopo, and Schwarz, Florian, Experimental evidence for existential presupposition projection from ‘none’ talk presentation at Amsterdam Colloquium 2015, Amsterdam
Invited talk “A challenge for parsing-based approaches to presupposition projection and triviality” presso the Linguae group all'Ecole Normale Supérieure, Parigi, Francia
Mandelkern, Matthew and Romoli, Jacopo, Parsing, presuppositions, and the calculation of local contexts, talk presentation, Sinn und Bedeutung 21, University of Edinburgh, Edinburgh
Sudo, Yasutada, Romoli, Jacopo (2017) Lifetime effects as presuppositional scalar strengthening, SALT 27, Maryland University
Invited talk “A unified account of the inferences of disjunction under modals” presso l'University of California, San Diego, USA
Invited talk “Presuppositions and local contexts” presso la Frankfürt University, Frankfürt, Germania
Invited talk “Asymmetry in language: the case of presuppositions” presso la Göttingen University, Göttingen, Germania
Invited talk “Plurals and Multiplicity Inferences across languages” presso University of Potsdam, Germania
“So what about presuppositions?”, invited commentary to Simon Charlow’s talk Dynamic and Static Exceptional Scope, Workshop Meaning as action, March the 18h, Oxford University, Oxford

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Post-Doctoral fellow presso la Macquarie University (Sydney, AU)
Lecturer in Linguistics, School of Communication, Ulster University, Belfast, UK
Senior Lecturer in Linguistics, School of Communication, Ulster University

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Big Lottery Fund grant per il progetto "Language made fun!" in collaborazione con Barnardo's charity e Raffaella Folli, Christina Sevdali, Catrin Rhys e Alison Henry (Ulster University). Valore del grant: £27.000. Ruolo: Co-investigator

British Academy small research grant per il progetto "On the interaction between morpho-syntax and semantics/pragmatics. The case of Temporal Implicatures" in collaborazione con Yasutada Sudo (UCL) e Raffaella Folli (Ulster University). Valore del grant: £8.029 Ruole: Principal Investigator

Grant di ricerca del Leverhulme Trust per progetto "Plural mass nouns as a window into language variation" in collaborazione con George Tsoulas (University of York) e Raffaella Folli (Ulster University). Valore del Grant: £134.267. Ruolo: Co-investigatore

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Associate Investigator presso il Centre of Excellence in Cognition and its Disorders, Institute of Human Cognition and Brain Science alla Macquarie University (Sydney, AU)

SIAS summer institute fellowship "The Investigation of Linguistic Meaning: In the Armchair, in the Field, and in the Lab" presso il National Humanities Center in North Carolina e il Wissenschaftskolleg di Berlino.
